p: Linalyl acetate has narcotic effects [ 177]. It is non-toxic, and is very minimally skin reactive [ 8]. When tested at 5–20%, no skin reaction was observed [ 186]. Similar to linalool, linalyl acetate does not cause photo-irritation or photo-allergy because it does not absorb UV light in the range of 290–400 nm [ 182]. It has no carcinogenic activity [ 8]. The acute dermal LD 50 was higher than 5 g/kg in rabbits, while the acute oral LD 50 was 14.5 g/kg in rats and 13.5 g/kg in mice [ 184].
